result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2,  credit for 0 days, Huber privileges for child care, mental health treatment, AODA treatment and medical treatment.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 11/19/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 11/19/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Participate in an education program.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
Successfully complete a parenting course.
No drivers license suspension.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L Hernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda L Hernandez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont. Nick Cerwin for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 2,  credit for 0 days, Huber privileges for child care, mental health treatment, AODA treatment and medical treatment. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS.   
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to Count 1 credit for 0 days, Huber privileges for child care, mental health treatment, AODA treatment and medical treatment. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 12 MONTHS.   
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Participate in an education program
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Successfully complete a parenting course
-No drivers license suspension
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 11/19/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 11/19/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Amanda L Hernandez not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  JDefendant's appearance is waived for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to Modify Bail filed by the State. sab

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Amanda L Hernandez not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/8/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Amanda L Hernandez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Amanda L Hernandez in custody.  Brandon Wigley for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L Hernandez
Current: 430 E Holt St, Milwaukee, WI 53207   (Effective: 03-29-2015)
Prior: 3025 West Mitchell Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Amanda L Hernandez in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Amanda L Hernandez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
